poem:
Promises in the Morning

In the gray dawn   
quiet strides, visions   
of bobbies on every street—   
Keir dreams change,   
shadow missions:   
thirteen thousand more,   
whispered milestones,   
house rises,   
energy's secure hum.   
The paper echoes,   
each pledge a pebble,   
ripples in still waters.  
Hope circles thin,  
morning promises re-born.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer seeks to relaunch premiership with new promise to crack down on crime Keir Starmer will attempt to reset his premiership with a series of pledges to show he is “delivering change”, including 13,000 extra neighbourhood police and a named “bobby on every beat”. In a speech Labour hopes will set out the “next phase” of government, the prime minister will detail half a dozen “milestone” targets covering living standards, NHS backlogs, secure energy, housebuilding". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
